dialogues.text: It's already almost midnight.

dialogues.speaker: RICO
dialogues.text: Night fishing is when they least expect it.

dialogues.speaker: MARC
dialogues.text: Their guard is down. Peter looks to Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I think we’ll pass tonight. See you guys later. She hands Peter a beer and leads him back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: They seem nice.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: They’re meth heads. They go spear fishing every night at two in the morning. There used to be four of them. (Peter laughs) I’m not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH HH  61.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh, man. Hey, did you know there's a picture of you flashing in the men’s room?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Kemo took it. I was so wasted.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Haven't you asked him to take it down?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Obviously, but he says it will ruin the balance in the collage. Hey, I have a surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Really? What? The band brings their song to an end and the lead singer speaks into the mic.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SINGER
dialogues.text: For our next song, we have a special guest from the mainland. Singing a number from his Dracula Musical, please welcome Peter Quint. Scattered applause. Peter looks at Rachel and shakes his head, resigned. He heads to the stage and takes a seat be the piano.

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST
dialogues.text: Be nice to her. Peter sits, but leans into the mic before he begins.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Really, I can sing something else. I think out of context...the Dracula voice might be...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA MUSICAL
dialogues.text: She claps, and the crowd joins in.  62.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (nervous ) Alright. Peter begins playing the piano. He signs in a strange Dracula voice.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's getting kind of hard to believe things are going to get better. But having you here now I see things are going to be brighter. Feeling you here now I know I just might make it through. Loving you this long has made me believe in forever. And with you these dreams I've forgotten might some how come true... Just as the bar starts to get used to the weird song, the music takes a dark turn and Dracula seems to get angry.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when Van Helsing comes calling I swear to the Lord I will slay him. He'd take you from me but I swear I won't let it be so. His blood will run down my face once he is decapitated. His head on my mantle is how I will let the World know..-how much I love you. Peter and Rachel make eye contact. She smiles a smile we haven't seen before. Their gaze lingers as MICHAEL has a at her table. They speak while Peter is singing.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Weird song. But he’s cute.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He’s kinda weird.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Die! Die! Die!!!!! (sadly) I can't. Peter finishes. People clap kind of. Rachel gives hima standing ovation. Peter is touched that Rachel is clappin for his obviously strange performance. They share a smile  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Rachel take what should be a romantic walk thro Waikiki. However, Waikiki at 3:00 am is not a romantic place. The street is peppered with drug dealers and prostitutes, many of whom are transvestites. Every few fe Peter waves off being given a flyer for Strip Clubs.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So, yeah. I pretty much quit my life and moved out here for him. Mr. Perfect Surfer Stud. Thought I'd pick up classes at University of Hawaii, but I was also working full time so...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: So, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: After about three weeks he told me he wasn’t ready for a commitment. I moved out the next day, he left for the tour and that’s that.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He was just a boy. I can see that now. Though I would like very much to beat the shit out of him someday. Peter chuckles. They pass a STRIP CLUB. THE DOORMAN tries coax them inside.

dialogues.speaker: STRIP CLUB BARKER
dialogues.text: You guys want a couples show? Anything you like. Private rooms. One of you, both of you, any combination you can think of.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No thank you. (to Rachel) You wanna go sit on the actual beach?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Rachel sit on the beach and talk.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Don’t you ever think about going back?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Why not? I mean... you could still finish school. A transvestite and a man return from having sex.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I hated L.A. Besides, I think it’s better not to think about the future. Right now, I work at a hotel. There doesn’t have to be a future in it.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: That’s such a cool attitude. I wish I could be that mellow.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Stay here long enough and you will.

dialogues.speaker: RICO
dialogues.text: FISH! We caught a shitload of fish.

dialogues.speaker: MARC
dialogues.text: Snuck up on them!! Caught em!! You guys want to have some fish with us?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Where’s Walnut? Long beat. RACHEL (CONT’D) I think I should probably get home. a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel PULLS UP to drop Peter off.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You want to hang out tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: If I get a break, why not?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Cool. Peter waits to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, are you getting out or not? Peter gets out. Rachel drives off with a wave. Peter wave back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter wakes in bed with a smile. Sun streams through the windows. He looks at the clock. 6:00 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter eats his breakfast at a table that is RIGHT NEXT TO KITCHEN. We watch him as he eats, though every couple of seconds, our view is blocked by the swinging doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter heads over to the surf shack where Jack is dealing a young kid and his dad. He spots Peter.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey Bro-sepe. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wanted to see if you were available for a lesson, but looks like you’re busy.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Wanna fool around on a kook-board? It’s easy. +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter walks backwards in his fins to the shorebreak. He w for the next whitewater, then clumsily flops onto the boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of breath, Peter finally paddles up to the surfer who sits on his board waiting for the next set. It is WILLIAM shirtless and fit.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Hello there.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. You surf too.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No, never tried. It’s easier than it looks though. Growing up I was a proper little skateboarder, so my balance is pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, good seeing you. I’m just gonna paddle a little more, try to get some exercise. Peter begins paddling with purpose. Sadly, he is working against the current and does not move at all.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I owe you an apology. For the other night at dinner. I totally overstepped my bounds. You need to move at your own pace, and I’m sorry for trying to force the issue. Peter is momentarily taken aback by William’s compassion.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No prob. They bob for a moment in silence.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It's just that when Brittany and I got divorced it was so amicable...I guess I just wish that good fortune upon everyone.  67.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You were married?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Seems like a lifetime ago now, but yes. We’re the best of friends. I met her on my program in England, when I was twenty. She used to spin at Chocolate Sauce.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wow. And what...what “program” was this?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It was called “Fancy Boys.” Peter tries not to chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes I know. Tough title. Believe me, I didn’t audition for it. Got “discovered” in a coffee shop. One minute some older gentleman is asking me if I want to be an actor, the next I’m all over the BBC playing How’s your Father with the Constable's son. Funny how things go. Peter and William share a laugh, then silence. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (begrudgingly) I don’t blame you for anything.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I’m glad. And for whatever it’s worth, I thought you guys had ended things before I ever... Peter tenses a bit.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Hadn’t we? William gives Peter a look which conveys volumes.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (growing tense) Jesus man. I believe you’re trying your best, but for a British dude you sure are low on tact.  68. A large wave is approaching. William sees the wave and begins paddling to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (tentative) That wave looks a little big. I'd be careful.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It couldn't be worse than this conversation. I think I’1l manage. William positions himself perfectly and is swept up by th wave. Nimble as a gazelle, he leaps to his feet. Peter watches with disdain as he rides towards the shore, a bro Adonis. William turns back and gives Peter a smile which not returned. Then...BANG! William’s board smashes into a rock, sending him crashing beneath the wave. Peter can’t but laugh. He waits for William to surface. And he waits. waits. William does not emerge from the water. Instead, o the top of William’s board can be seen protruding vertica from the water, a sure sign he is trapped below.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Shit. Peter ditches his board and begins swimming for William.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Peter follows the board’s leash down towards the reef and sees William, panicked and struggling, leg trapped in the reef. He reaches out a hand towards Peter, who grabs it a tries to pull him up. William does not budge, but lets ou silent scream of pain. After a furious effort, William’s breaks free from the reef and the two head for the surfac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pair emerge from the water. *

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Sorry. Can you paddle? *

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I think so. * The two head towards shore, William paddling, Peter swimm  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter helps the hobbling William to shore where Jack is giving the young kid pre-surf instruction. He runs over.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You alright there, brother?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I can barely move my leg.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Well I can see why. He points at Williams leg, and we now see that a large CH OF REEF is stuck in his leg, protruding through the skin.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (gagging) Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You better pull that out. William tries, but even bending is excruciating.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I can’t do it. Peter turns to Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (calm) I’m not a doctor, legally. Besides, he could sue me and the hotel. (to Peter) You do it.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m not good with...stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Please Peter, get it out of me. Peter winces and grabs the exposed coral.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ready?  70.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Do it....AAHHHH! That hurts!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s almost out. Peter is oddly enjoying pulling the coral out.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It looks like you should pull it the other way.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Peter pulls it in the other direction and wrenches out th rather large piece of coral as William screams in pain. T all look down at Williams leg, which actually seems okay.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thank God. It actually doesn’t look too bad. Then, BLOOD POURS FROM THE WOUND. Peter turns white.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (weak) I don’t feel so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter wakes up laying on a large bed and sees Sarah stand over him, concerned. As he slowly regains his consciousne he smiles at her and glances to his side. There next to h lays William, leg bandaged and asleep.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (groggy) What’s going on? Is he OK? *

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: He'll be fine. They gave him some * stitches and painkillers. You * passed out. The doctor said you were dehydrated. Have you had any drinks today.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Only like twelve Mai Tais, but those have juice in them. * (then) * (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why am I talking to you? Your boyfriend just apologized to me for sleeping with you before we broke up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. I’m sorry. Just relax for a minute. You shouldn’t be up and around...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t want you touching me. They share a long look and Sarah’s chin starts to tremble

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened Sarah? I understand it’s over. I really do. I just would like to understand what I did to make you cheat...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You didn’t do anything Pete. You were great.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Not great enough to keep other dicks out of you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I will never stop caring about you. Though the conversation grows in intensity, both try not wake William.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I know and we'll be friends forever etc. and so on. Can we please just cut the bullshit! You owe me that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fine. Because Peter, it got hard to keep taking care of you when you stopped taking care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh, c’mon.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: For God sakes, you were drunk at the 10:00 am Yoga class!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + Fe HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a rough little period.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You’ve stopped even trying to make things better. You drink, and you smoke, and you sit there alone in your apartment watching Rocky Horror Picture Show.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s inspirational.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It's fun one midnight every three years, anything more than that is fucking weird, I’m sorry. Peter, there was one week when you were sweatpants every day.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I did not! INT. PETER’S APARTMENT - FLASHBACK SIX QUICK SHOTS OF Peter LOUNGING ABOUT HIS HOUSE IN THE SWEATPANTS, BUT DIFFERENT T-SHIRTS. ONE FINAL SHOT OF Pet IN ONLY BOXERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we’re back...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I want to have FUN Peter. We stopped having any fun. We were “supportive” of each other, and that’s it. Someday I’m going to be married and be a mother and my career will be over and I want to look back and think “Damn, I had a good time.”

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Part of being in a relationship is “for better or for worse.” You're supposed to be comfortable being there for me even if I’m depressed for three or four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH HH HH a  73.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: For better or for worse is MARRIAGE Peter. Get it? I’m not doing “for better or for worse” in my twenties. I’m looking for “for better.”

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, great. You and your fun husband have a super duper fun life. Peter leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter exits the elevator, perturbed and spots Rachel at t front desk. Rachel spots him and begins singing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (doing his Dracula voice) And when I see Von Helsing I swear to the lord I will slay him. That shit gets stuck in your head man.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Look, I want to thank you for the room and everything, but I think I’m gonna take off.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You've got the Kapua Suite for a couple more nights, for free. What are you, some sort of moron?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No. I just... I don’t know what I’m doing here.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Saving people’s lives, that’s what I’ve heard. Peter shrugs it off with a bashful grin.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It was an accident. I wasn’t thinking. a +e

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I bet that was nice. C’mon, I’m off at seven. You want to go to Lazy Joe's?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Look, I loved Lazy Joe’s. Seriously, it was great, but if I’m gonna stick around, maybe we could go for a hike or a drive. Someplace far away from my ex-girlfriend. I heard something cool about Koolau Mountain.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. All the tourists do that. I’ve never been. Sounds like a pain in the ass. Plus it’s like a three hour drive, we'd have to leave by three at least.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s only two now, can you play hookie?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. Peter looks over to Michael in the office.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Michael, do you need her here? I wanna take her on a hike. Michael smiles at Rachel

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: How lovely. No, I don’t need her. She’s all yours. Peter gives Rachel a smile.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (almost begrudgingly) Aright. I’1l have the concierge hook us up with a map.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel hikes in front of Peter, who breathes rather heavi They walk

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: How you doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Awesome. I don’t think I’ve ever been this covered in sweat. It’s like I have a fever.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Told you it was pain in the ass up here. We could be at Lazy Joe’s right now. a few steps further and are now overlooking a WATERFALL which cascades into a pool below. They both stare out, Peter is in awe. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Mountains his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're SARAH stand at the top of the Santa Monica overlooking the city. She reaches out and touches — DAY back. Peter looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You sure? Are you gonna throw up again?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No, really I’m alright. I just... I’m a fucking mess.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You’re not even touching the mess I was.  76.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Well, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No I’m serious. I mean, I got a back tattoo. Rachel shows him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Wow. Is that...a potato with a knife in it?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It’s supposed to be a human heart. Jack did it for me when my boyfriend left, but he was fucking wasted.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You must love Potatoes. You should get some tater tots too, right next to it.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (playful) Fuck off. Peter laughs. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s funny, but being hurt like that makes me feel kind of...impervious to pain.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Nothing left to be afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Exactly. Jumping off this waterfall ain’t gonna hurt me as much as she did, so what’s there to be afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: So jump then.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (off guard) I meant that as a metaphor.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Why should it be a metaphor? Back up and jump, man.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Is it safe? She JUMPS OFF the waterfall. Peter watches the pool with concern until finally she resurfaces, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (calling up) I can’t believe I survived that! You coming or what?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You must be crazy!!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I can see your vagina from here. Jump ! Peter closes his eyes and winces.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP
dialogues.text: Peter takes a deep breath and begins his leap from the waterfall. However, about halfway through, he loses his n and his body seizes. His feet do not jump, but instead, s out from under him. He slams down hard onto the edge of t cliff. He manages to grab onto a tree root before plummet

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m okay!! I’1l just let go.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No! It’s like, really dangerous now. If you fall straight down, you'll hit the rocks and kill yourself.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Can you pull yourself up?!?! Peter tries, but is too weak and his grip is awkward.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Peter hangs in peril, we see several VERY YOUNG Hawaii kids leap off the Waterfall and fall out of frame behind

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, maybe put your feet up against the cliff and like...shoot yourself off.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Like a frog?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but that sounds like a plan. Peter awkwardly puts his legs up against the cliff face l a frog. As he does so, the PHOTO MAN and PHOTO WOMAN jump off and fall out of frame past him.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Okay, here I go.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m scared. The group of swimmers below watch the hanging Peter. They begin to chant.

dialogues.speaker: SWIMMERS
dialogues.text: JUMP!/JUMP YOU PUSSY!/I’M A KID,

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (laughing) This is ridiculous. He launches himself backwards and plunges into the pool below. After a while, he emerges with a huge smile.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You saw me, right?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I witnessed it. I was there. The two tread water about a foot apart, exhilirated. THEY KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Rachel sit on benches outside of a small local stand. They eat fresh fish and rice, silent and happy. A 79. food large bowl of dirty looking water is also on the table. T sun sets on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m feeling very calm.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It's the Kava. He touches her hand on the table.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I’m not a romantic person. Peter begins to pull his hand away, put she softly grabs RACHEL (CONT’D) This is amazing. Peter smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It’s nice to hear that word mean something.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Sarah have dinner with another couple.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: The asparagus is amazing. EXT. MANN’S CHINESE - FLASHBACK Peter and Sarah walk out of a screening with Johnny Knoxville.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You were amazing Johnny. it.  80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter waits on a chair in a shi-shi boutique.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, you ready? Peter looks up from his magazine.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Ready. Sarah emerges from the dressing room holding her CHIHUAHU which is wearing a TURTLENECK SWEATER.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Amazing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we’re back...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I guess...I don’t know, you’re sincere. Peter dips his bowl in the dirty water and takes another

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (smiling) My mouth is numb.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Mine too. I can’t feel my lips. Peter looks at her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Peter leans in and kisses her softly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No. They share a smile and she feeds him a bite of rice.  81.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That was pretty bold of you.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (whispering) I’ll be right back, baby. I promise. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter gets out of the elevator. He sees Rachel sitting on couch, waiting. He composes himself and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Rachel. I can’t hang out tonight. I’ve had an absolutely amazing time, but I don’t think I’m going to be able to do this.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What’s with that weird artificial voice? (imitating a recording) “To leave a message just press one or wait for the tone.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a  She looks 102.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Sarah has come to her senses and I just think that I owe the five and a half years we spent together the chance for us to work things out. I’m sorry. at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to hurt you. That was the last thing I intended. Rachel shakes her head at him with disappointment, but st very calm in the way only a livid woman can.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Alright, well. Thanks. And good luck.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: It's fine. I didn’t expect anything from you. I don’t even know you...

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: --- but can I offer you a suggestion? I'd be real careful about your ladyfriend. Peter tenses.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t know how trustworthy she is.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You know what? I’m sorry I hurt you, but that’s not necessary.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Good luck. a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Sarah sit on the PATIO of the buffet overlookin the water. Peter IS IN HEAVEN. Sarah looks down at her fo

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: This is breathtaking. It’s paradise. Sarah gives him a half-smile. Peter notices.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you okay? She puts down her knife and fork and gives Peter a look t is all too familiar. Before she can say anything, Peter JUMPS UP.

dialogues.speaker: AGAIN YOU STUPID BITCH
dialogues.text: Other diners watch on in horror as Peter runs out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter runs to the front desk. Rachel is not there, so he approaches Michael.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Is Rachel here?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No. And you’re an asshole. Peter runs to the elevator. INT. PETER’S ROOM - LATER Peter sits on his bed, phone at his ear.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (into phone) Please call me back. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. Please. Call me back. I’m sorry. It was just a hiccup! I’m going to keep calling. He hangs up the phone in frustration and checks the clock 10:45 AM.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) It doesn’t end like this. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is at the Hawaiian Arline’s counter.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: We’re very full. All we have is one seat in business class, which is...$1259. Peter reaches into his pocket and removes a wad.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I‘1ll take it. The agent types away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter is pulling on his shoes as he arrives at the gate. sees Sarah in the short boarding line and stops. She turn around and the two lock eyes. She slowly heads over.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? You have more names you want to call me!? Or do you just want to kill me?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I don’t think I made myself clear.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You said “I never want to see you again you stupid bitch.”

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I said those things. Sarah looks at him, confused and guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Peter, I don’t know what to do. Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: One thing I know is that this has been the worst month of my life --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: And the other thing I know is that we should not be together. Sarah nods, tearing up a little.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am sure that the next time we run into each other it’1ll be weird, because I don’t really want to see you again -- Sarah and Peter laugh, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But just know that I really, truly hope you find everything you're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I hope you do too.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Goodbye. EXT. SARAH’S APARTMENT BLDG - NIGHT, 6 YEARS AGO Peter and Sarah stand inches apart.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Can I kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We work together? Do you think it’s smart?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in and kisses her tenderly. Their first kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter dials his cell.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Rachel, It’s Peter. Please call me on my cell. I know I keep calling, but I want to see you and I’m sorry. Please. I’m sorry. Bye. He hangs up. Then lets out a LONG, FRUSTRATED YELL. INT. LAZY JOE’S - LATER 106. Peter walks into Lazy Joe’s with purpose and heads into t bathroom. After a long beat, a loud BANGING is heard from within. KEMO heads into the bathroom to see what’s up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter makes his way to the front desk, his face now BEATE and BRUISED. Rachel holds up a hand before he can speak.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk to you right now.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Please, can I just...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You don’t need to explain, I get it, just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Rachel I made a terrible mist---

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: (cutting him off, yelling)

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE ME THE FUCK ALONE
dialogues.text: Michael walks over from the office to check on the commot RACHEL (CONT’D) I understand you’re “a mess right now.” I get it. I was a mess too. I slept with a couple people I was disgusted to wake up next to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at her, hurt. RACHEL (CONT’D) Not you Michael. (back to Peter) I get it, okay? But it doesn’t excuse acting like a complete asshole. It doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I meant everything I said.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You told me you loved me. Then you put your dick in another woman’s vagina. Do you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: It wasn’t just a vagina. It was a woman I was with for six years’ vagina. I was so confused! Please believe me! Imagine if it was your ex-boyfriend, how would you feel?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: He’s not my ex-boyfriend he’s my ex- husband.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: What!? He was your husband?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: For like six weeks and then we got it annulled. We haven’t seen in each other in like forever. (then) Don’t try to turn this around on me!

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Look, I don’t know what to say about that at all! But I don’t think I care. I know I’m crazy, but you’re crazy too! I’m begging you, be crazy with me. I'll be sane with you. We can be a great team.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: What? What does that even mean?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: (continuing) -.-You’re not happy here! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH HH

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not that laid back!! You should be in school and you know that!

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Get it through your fucking brain!! You shouldn't be with anyone! You’re a lunatic! You fucking sucked me in then you treated me like shit! Why would I want you?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You’re right. I don’t know what I’m thinking. I’m acting crazy again. I’m being codependent and selfish and bizarre.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t really know what “co- dependent” is. All I know is I want you to leave. Don’t write me. Don’t call me. Don’t text me. Don’t email me. Get it? He backs away from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I won’t bother you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Get off my island. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter sits with his bags watching the sunrise. It is clea hasn’t slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter closes his eyes as the plane takes off, leaving Haw behind. INT. PETER’S APARTMENT - LATER Peter enters his dark apartment and sets his bags down. H flicks on a light and looks around his apartment, littere with bottles of booze, overflowing ashtrays and dirty clothes. After a moment, he goes and gets a garbage bag a BEGINS TO CLEAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Michael approach Kemo at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: KEMO
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry about beating up your Howlee Boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: That was you?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Don’t apologize. He was a Bigfoot looking bastard.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: I don’t care, but why?

dialogues.speaker: KEMO
dialogues.text: He came in and stole your picture from the bathroom. He said some bullshit about how you’re an angel and should be treated with respect. It was hard to understand him cause I had just punched him in the esophagus. Rachel takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS EXTREMELY SMALL THEATER IS PACKED with people. A DRACULA PUPPET HOLDS CENTER STAGE, illuminated by a lone spotlight. He is being operated by PETER, who wears a bla UNITARD and FACEPAINT for as not to be seen by the audien

dialogues.text: How could she want you, you're not even human? How could she want you, you're not even a man?

dialogues.text: I don't care what you say, nasty wench, of my love, for it is love that will save my damned soul!!! PYROTECHNICS GO OFF, and SEVERAL BAT PUPPETS SWOOP DOWN F THE RAFTERS SINGING. The full cast begins to enter as in FINALE OF LES MISERABLES. The audience starts to laugh hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: BATS
dialogues.text: Fly to you! I'll fly to you!! Until the end of time I'll fly to you!!

dialogues.speaker: ZOMBIE CHORUS
dialogues.text: Run to you, I'll run to you. Until the stars don't shine I'll run to youll!

dialogues.speaker: VAMPIRESSES
dialogues.text: Drink from you. I'll drink from you! Until your blood runs dry I'll drink from you!!

dialogues.speaker: DRACULA
dialogues.text: BE WITH YOU, JUST BE WITH YoU!! I'D

dialogues.speaker: FORSAKE THE LORD JUST TO BE WITH
dialogues.text: You!!! They reach a remarkable crescendo. Everyone singing their parts over the other until finally their lyrics unify!

dialogues.speaker: YOU MY LOOOOOOOOOVVWWWVWVWVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, in jeans and his black UNITARD, face half clean li raccoon, holds court and greets the audience as they leav HE IS APPROACHED BY RACHEL. Peter is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Rachel. Wow, hi. What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Some kids at school were talking about some hilarious Dracula musical. She motions to two REALLY GOOD LOOKING 19 YEAR OLD GUYS WAITING ACROSS THE LOBBY.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You're back in school? That’s great.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Sort of. I’m at Santa Monica City College. I don’t like being surrounded by eighteen year olds, but, what are you gonna do? The parties can be pretty good. Anyway, the show was great. So funny.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Thanks. I didn’t realize it was a comedy, but once someone pointed that out to me, it sort of opened everything up.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: Well, it’s great you got it up on it’s feet. How’s the TV show going?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: I actually ended up quitting, which was terrifying. Had to move to a smaller apartment in kind of a scary neighborhood, but here I am. Lingering beat.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You never called or anything.  112.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: You told me not to. She smiles. He grabs a flyer and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: PETER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well listen, I should probably say some hellos, but my email address is on the back. Let me know if you want to go to Lazy Joe’s sometime. She laughs. He smiles and moves on to some other patrons. Rachel and walks out of the theater with her friends. SECONDS LATER Peter’S PHONE VIBRATES. He reaches into his pocket, removes his blackberry and checks his email. It reads: “TURN AROUND.” Peter smiles, turns around and, there she is, right behin him. She grabs him and kisses him hard.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: You’re not stalking anyone else, are you?

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Nope. You’re not married?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: Then maybe this has a chance. They kiss a bunch more. THE END. OVER THE REST OF THE CREDITS we see all of the sad, funny embarrassing photos our photo couple snapped of Peter throughout the week.
